anime.description: The anime is based on the classical Chinese novel The Romance of the Three Kingdoms and is set in present-day China, where famous figures from history and the novel can be summoned using cards. The story centers on http://anidb.net/ch84103 [Son Shin], a high school student who hates studying China`s Warring States period, and http://anidb.net/ch84102 [Shuu Yu], a female general from the Chinese state of Wu who has been revived in the present day. Source: ANN

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

episode.title: 厄[わざわい]
Disaster
Désastre
Wazawai
episode.summary: With Chou-sensei defeated, the real bad guy is revealed: Hakuanshi, a servant of Kentei who was manipulating him for his own purposes. Hakuanshi uses more powerful generals, and more than just one. Even with the help of his mysterious classmate Ryofu, Sonshin has no choice but to flee. But Hakuanshi isn`t willing to let him go easily... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 夕[ゆうべ]
Twilight
Crépuscule
Yuube
episode.summary: Trapped on the roof, Sonshin has nowhere to run against Chou-sensei. He`s forced to fight, but his spiritual power is weak. He attempts to surrender to spare Shuuyu any further pain, but as her armor glints in the setting sun, it seems he has another plan in mind... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 了[さとり]
Enlightenment
Illumination
Satori
episode.summary: Chou-sensei continues to pursue Shuuyu and Sonshin throughout the school. Sonshin lacks the spiritual power needed to fully use Shuuyu`s abilities, so he has no choice but to flee. The situation grows even more dire when the two of them are trapped on the roof, and Gien destroys the fire escapes, leaving them nowhere to run... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 乙
Soul Buster
Soul Buster
Otsu
episode.summary: Sonshin is a young high school boy in China who finds himself caught up in an ancient battle between the forces attempting to revive the emperor Kentei and who would stop them. A mysterious benefactor gives him a choice of cards, which will allow him to summon warriors from the romance of the three kingdoms to do his bidding. He summons the great general Shuuyu, but very quickly finds out that the game is more deadly than he bargained for... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 炎[ほむら]
Flames
Flammes
Homura
episode.summary: Sonshin finally takes the badly wounded Shuuyu to the southern palace, where Ryouun`s grandfather agrees to treat her. But in other to cure her from the poison that consumes her energy, he`ll have to go deep inside his mind, where the bond between Lord and General will be tested. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 臣[しもべ]
Servant
Serviteur
Shimobe
episode.summary: Ryouun and Sonshin proceed to the Southern Palace, which is located in a lake at the back of a bamboo forest. But Hakuanshin`s plots run deeper than they suspected, and a second assassin awaits. When Ryouun is badly wounded, her general goes off to duel the assassin... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 戎
Ebisu
Ebisu
Ebisu
episode.summary: Ryouun and Sonshin are fleeing to the Southern Palace, pursued by another of Hakuanshin`s generals. On their way, they are trapped in a labyrinthine neighborhood, and led into an ambush by a group of neighborhood thugs. But the head thug is tougher than the others, and he`s strong enough to even fight Ryouun`s general! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 矢[くさび]
Arrow
Entraves
Kusabi
episode.summary: Ryouun and Sonshin continue to fight against Hakuanshi`s generals. Sonshin`s spiritual energy is beginning to run out, and it won`t be long before he`s completely dry. But even after he temporarily repels this foe, he still has to deal with a reckless and angry Shuuyu, who blunders straight into a trap... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 朝[あした]
Tomorrow
Demain
Ashita
episode.summary: A massive rock blocks the way out of the Southern Palace. Only by combining the powers of General and Lord can Ryouun and Sonshin hope to move it. Hakuanshin waits outside for the palace to collapse, because when it does he will get the last bit of Kanu`s card. Can they escape the collapsing palace in time? And if they do, what will be their next destination? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 崩[くずれ]
Collapse
Effondrement
Kuzure
episode.summary: With the Southern Palace collapsing around them, Sonshin and Ryouun frantically search for a way out. But Hakuanshi summons a revived, and even more powerful Gien to stop them! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 鬼[あらがみ]
Demon
Démon
Aragami
episode.summary: The legendary card, Kanu, is revealed to be the object of Hakuanshi`s pursuit. But when Ryouuun gets the card first, she goes out of control. Can Sonshin restore her sanity? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 契[ちぎり]
Vow
Serment
Chigiri
episode.summary: After the loss of her last General, Ryouun wants power, and a lot of it. She turns to the enshrined warrior of the southern palace, the legendary war god Kanu. But will she be able to master his incredible might, or will he drain her of her own power and drive her to her death? Source: crunchyroll
